review.title: Inaccuracy Minimization by Partioning Fuzzy Data Sets - Validation of Analystical Methodology
review.abstract: In the last two decades, a number of methods have been proposed for forecasting based on fuzzy time series. Most of the fuzzy time series methods are presented for forecasting of car road accidents. However, the forecasting accuracy rates of the existing methods are not good enough. In this paper, we compared our proposed new method of fuzzy time series forecasting with existing methods. Our method is based on means based partitioning of the historical data of car road accidents. The proposed method belongs to the kth order and time-variant methods. The proposed method can get the best forecasting accuracy rate for forecasting the car road accidents than the existing methods.

metadata.title: Inaccuracy Minimization by Partitioning Fuzzy Data Sets – Validation of an Analytical Methodology

sections.text: Most of the fuzzy time series methods are presented for predicting car accidents using 11 classic terms. However, the prediction accuracy rates of the existing methods are not good enough. In this essay we compared our proposed new method of fuzzy time series prediction Lee with existing methods. Our method is based on means that are based on the partitioning of historical data of car accidents. The proposed method belongs to the kth order and time variant methods. The proposed method can get the best prediction accuracy rate for predicting car accidents than the existing methods. Keywords fuzzy sets, fuzzy logical groups, fuzzy data, fuzzytime series.I. INTRODUCTIONForecasting activities play an important role in our daily life. During the last two decades, various approaches for predicting time series have been developed. Among them, ARMA models and Box Jenkins approaches are very famous. However, the classical time series predictions cannot be used to bypass the predictions of time series.

sections.heading: Dr. S.K.Srivatsa
sections.text: Senior Professor, St. Joseph's College of Engg, Jeppiaar Nagar, Chennai-600 064 Dr.S.K.Srivatsa was born on July 21, 1945 in Bangalore. He received his Bachelor of Electronics and Communication Engineering Degree (Honors) from Javadpur University (Securing First Rank and Two Medals). Master Degree in Electrical Communication Engineering (With Distinction) from the Indian Institute of Science and Ph.D also from the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore. In July 2005 he retired as Professor of Electrical Engineering from Anna University. He has taught twenty-two different courses at U.G. Level and 40 different courses at P.G. Level over the last 32 years. He served as a member of the Board of Studies in several educational institutions. His name is included in the database of the Computer Society of India of Resource Professionals. He has received about a dozen awards. He is the author of over 350 publications.

metadata.abstractText: In the last two decades, a number of methods have been proposed for forecasting based on fuzzy time series. Most of the fuzzy time series methods are presented for forecasting of car road accidents. However , the forecasting accuracy rates of the existing methods are not good enough. In this paper, we compared our proposed new method of fuzzy time series forecasting with existing methods. Our method is based on means based partitioning of the historical data of car road accidents. The proposed method belongs to the kth order and time-variant methods. The proposed method can get the best forecasting accuracy rate for forecasting the car road accidents than the existing methods. KeywordsFuzzy sets, Fuzzy logical groups, fuzzified data, fuzzy time series.
